title: Test Windows NTFS rename atomicity for dispatch protocol
description: The dispatch protocol uses atomic rename (mv from tmp/ to new/) for crash-safe delivery. We're on Windows (win32). Need to verify: (1) Git Bash mv is atomic on NTFS, (2) PowerShell Move-Item is atomic on NTFS. If neither is atomic, we need a fallback (e.g., write + rename within same volume). Ref: dispatch-protocol.md open items.
